CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper March 28, 1953, pg. 13, reads: "Training to be Lifeguards - The threatened shortage of male lifeguards in city and county pools this year has brought out a crop of female swimming experts who think that they can do the job as well if not better than the men. Training at the East Liberty YMCA on Whitfield Street are the two ladies shown here... Miss Hord and Miss Thomas as shown, left to right, in the left hand picture. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Gailya Hord and Shirley Thomas at edge of indoor swimming pool during lifeguard training at East Liberty YMCA
